trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_SEQ_00<tab>Erenville is relieved to see everything set to rights.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Namikka.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Erenville.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Erenville again.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ZEKOWA_000_001<tab>Hahaha! That was a pretty nice shot, right?
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ERENVILLE_000_010<tab>Now that we have the bracelet, let us return to Sheshenewezi Springs.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ZEKOWA_000_011<tab>Will you be staying there long? I'd like to give you a proper thanks after I find my friends.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ERENVILLE_000_012<tab>We weren't planning on it, but there's no need to rush. We'll see you at the Springs, then.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ZEKOWA_000_015<tab>I'll catch up to you just as soon as I've taken care of my friends.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_IYAATE_000_020<tab>Welcome back. I'm glad to hear those bandits got what they deserved.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ERENVILLE_000_023<tab>They were understandably worried, but I've told them of what happened in Hhusatahwi. Our minor adventure made for quite the tale.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_NAMIKKA_000_030<tab>My bracelet. Thank you. Thank you so much.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_NAMIKKA_000_031<tab>This is more than just a gift. It is a part of me I could never hope to replace.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_NAMIKKA_000_032<tab>Truly, Wuk Lamat is blessed to have such devoted friends.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ERENVILLE_000_033<tab>Well, I wouldn't put it quite that way... I prefer to think of us more as long-standing acquaintances.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_IYAATE_000_034<tab>Regardless of how you choose to describe it, there's no denying the depth of your bond. Though I'm sure you'll continue to do so.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_IYAATE_000_035<tab>Can't say I'm surprised the deputy chief turned out to be the bandits' leader. I always knew something wasn't right about him.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ERENVILLE_000_036<tab>An easy claim to make with the gift of hindsight.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ZEKOWA_000_037<tab>(-Zekowa-)There you are. The <var 1A 02 /var>real<var 1A 01 /var> Daybreakers have arrived!
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ZEKOWA_000_038<tab>I'd like you to meet my two best friends, Kwikana and Liwine.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_KWIKANA_000_039<tab>If it wasn't for you believing in Zekowa, and doing what you did, we'd still be locked up.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_KWIKANA_000_040<tab>You have no idea how satisfying it was to see that bastard Wihuwte put behind bars.

TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_LIWINE_000_041<tab>We never gave up hope that Zekowa would find a way to get us out. He always was the best of the Daybreakers. Glad he was able to convince you to go along with his plan.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_LIWINE_000_042<tab>Unfortunately, our group is smaller now, and lacking in strength besides. Some outlaws might see us as an easy target.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ZEKOWA_000_043<tab>Even so, if anyone should give the Dustwatch the slip, the Daybreakers'll be there!
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ZEKOWA_000_044<tab>We'll train night and day, so no one'll get the better of us ever again. Isn't that right?
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_KWIKANA_000_045<tab>Right! And you'll teach us how you draw your pistols so fast, won't you?
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_LIWINE_000_046<tab>Well, we won't need to duel if all goes as it should.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ZEKOWA_000_047<tab>But on the off chance it doesn't, we'd best make sure everyone can match or beat my speed.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ZEKOWA_000_048<tab>We owe you a great debt, and one of these days, I'll be sure to repay it. On that you have my word.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ZEKOWA_000_049<tab>Until we meet again.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_NAMIKKA_000_050<tab>If you'll excuse me, I shall find a quiet place to rest.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_NAMIKKA_000_051<tab>As I'll be here a while yet, though, do let me know if there is any way I can be of assistance.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ERENVILLE_000_052<tab>Were you not planning to take the train home?
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_IYAATE_000_053<tab>Oh, train service has been suspended. Didn't I tell you?
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ERENVILLE_000_054<tab>You mentioned no such thing.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_IYAATE_000_055<tab>Something about the tracks being damaged in the last quake. The tunnel was closed as well.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ERENVILLE_000_056<tab>An earthquake? It must have happened when we were still down south.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_IYAATE_000_057<tab>There've been quite a few tremors of late, and a rather large one struck not long before you two arrived. I can only hope no one was hurt...
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_IYAATE_000_058<tab>At any rate, if you want to know when service will resume, you could speak with the stationmaster yourself.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ERENVILLE_000_059<tab>Let's do that. The station is just over there.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_IYAATE_000_060<tab>I'd like to believe the train will be up and running again soon...
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_SHENZA_000_063<tab>I'm sorry, but there's nothing we can do with the tracks as they are.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ERENVILLE_000_065<tab>It seems people aren't too happy about the train delays.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_SHENZA_000_070<tab>We'll be ready to handle that timber when you and the chief get back.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ZAWPYA_000_075<tab>With your help, we'll get the railroad operating again. And then you'll have the chance to see our engine in motion─it's poetry, I tell you!
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_NITOWIKWE_000_080<tab>Right, we've got work to be getting on with ourselves!
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ERENVILLE_000_090<tab>Though no small number live in Shaaloani, I must confess that I've never visited the home of the Hhetsarro.
TEXT_KINGMD106_04917_ERENVILLE_000_091<tab>As they largely live in accordance with older traditions, I suspect they may have a dim view of the railroads...
